se.jkrau.mclib

Class MCLib

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.jkrau.mclib.MCLib

  • public class MCLib
extends java.lang.Object
    The official MCLib class. Instantiating this class will allow you to fully use MCLib's features.
    Author:
    Joe

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MCLib(java.lang.String mainClass)
      Shortcut constructor for classes with a public main method (defaults for main(String[] args))
      MCLib(java.lang.String entryClass, java.lang.String entryMethod)
      Constructor that defines the entry point's class, method, and parameters.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void craft(Craft craft)
      Add a Craft to MCLib for dynamic code injection.
      void craft(Craft craft, java.lang.String... classes)
      Attach a Craft to one or more classes, then add it to MCLib for dynamic code injection.

      Note: Despite what you think, this supports duplicate classes.
      void craft(java.lang.String className, Craft craft)
      Deprecated. 
      This only supports only one class, and doesn't support duplicate classes. Please use craft(se.jkrau.mclib.craft.Craft, String...) instead.
      void createLoader()
      Creates the Loader with all the arguments provided so far.

      Warning: Any new craft calls will require this method to be invoked again!
      Craft[] getCraftArray()
      Gets an array of Crafts added from craft(se.jkrau.mclib.craft.Craft)

      Warning: This is meant for the loader only! Only use this unless you know what you're doing.
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Craft> getCraftMap()
      Gets a map of Crafts added from craft(se.jkrau.mclib.craft.Craft, String...)
      Filter getFilter()
      Gets the Filter for MCLib.
      Loader getLoader()
      Gets the Loader for this MCLib injection.

      Warning: There is no use case of getting the loader! But use at your own risk anyways.
      void run(java.lang.Object entryInstance, java.lang.Object... entryArgs)
      Executes the entry point method.

      Sure you could just use getLoader() and override the classloader manually, but heck, why do that when this method already has you covered!

      Warning: Without invoking this method, the Loader will not override the classloader!
      Note: Make sure you cast entryArgs to Object as well as make sure they match the parameter types in the main method otherwise you will get an exception.
      void setFilter(Filter filter)
      Sets the Filter for MCLib.
      void setLoader(Loader loader)
      Deprecated.

      • craft

        public void craft(Craft craft)
        Add a Craft to MCLib for dynamic code injection.
        Parameters:

      • craft

        @Deprecated
public void craft(java.lang.String className,
                    Craft craft)
        Deprecated. This only supports only one class, and doesn't support duplicate classes. Please use craft(se.jkrau.mclib.craft.Craft, String...) instead.
        Attach a Craft to a single class, then add it to MCLib for dynamic code injection.

        Parameters:
        className - String with class name to target
        craft - Craft

      • craft

        public void craft(Craft craft,
         java.lang.String... classes)
        Attach a Craft to one or more classes, then add it to MCLib for dynamic code injection.

        Note: Despite what you think, this supports duplicate classes. Just don't attach them in the same method call though (or you'll eat up a lot of PermGen space!)
        Parameters:
        craft - Craft
        classes - array of strings with one or more class names

      • setFilter

        public void setFilter(Filter filter)
        Sets the Filter for MCLib.
        Parameters:
        filter - Filter
        See Also:
        Craft

        Gets the Filter for MCLib.

      • getCraftArray

        public Craft[] getCraftArray()
        Gets an array of Crafts added from craft(se.jkrau.mclib.craft.Craft)

        Warning: This is meant for the loader only! Only use this unless you know what you're doing.
        Returns:
        array of crafts added by above method.

      • getCraftMap

        Returns:
        map of crafts added by above method.

      • createLoader

        public void createLoader()
        Creates the Loader with all the arguments provided so far.

        Warning: Any new craft calls will require this method to be invoked again!

      • setLoader

        @Deprecated
public void setLoader(Loader loader)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the Loader for this MCLib injection.

        Warning: This will not construct the loader for you like the createLoader() will!
        Warning: There is no use case of setting the loader as the one provided works. But use at your own risk anyways.
        Parameters:
        loader - the Loader to use for MCLib.
        See Also:
        Loader

      • getLoader

        public Loader getLoader()
        Gets the Loader for this MCLib injection.

        Warning: There is no use case of getting the loader! But use at your own risk anyways.
        Returns:
        Loader

      • run

        public void run(java.lang.Object entryInstance,
       java.lang.Object... entryArgs)
         throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException,
                java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Executes the entry point method.

        Sure you could just use getLoader() and override the classloader manually, but heck, why do that when this method already has you covered!

        Warning: Without invoking this method, the Loader will not override the classloader!
        Note: Make sure you cast entryArgs to Object as well as make sure they match the parameter types in the main method otherwise you will get an exception.
        Parameters:
        entryInstance - Object with an existing instance of the entry point class, usually null if you're calling the main method.
        entryArgs - Object array of arguments for the entry point method, usually just passing it along from your main method.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException
